verses.roman:
āji rātrye palāha, nā rahiha eka-jana
ṭhākura lañā bhāga', āsibe kāli yavana'

synonyms: āji rātrye—this night; palāha—go away; nā rahiha—do not remain; eka-jana—one person; ṭhākura—the Deity; lañā—taking; bhāga'-go away; āsibe—will come; kāli—tomorrow; yavana—the Mohammedan soldiers.
translation: "Flee this village tonight, and do not allow one person to remain. Take the Deity with you and leave, for the Mohammedan soldiers will come tomorrow."
